questions.question: What does a red traffic light signal mean?
questions.explanation: A red light signal means you must stop before the stop line or crosswalk.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of potential dangers ahead.

questions.question: What does a rectangular white sign with black lettering indicate?
questions.explanation: White rectangular signs with black lettering are regulatory signs.

questions.question: At an intersection, who has the right-of-way when both vehicles arrive at the same time at a four-way stop?
questions.explanation: At four-way stops, the driver on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on most Oklahoma highways?
questions.explanation: Most Oklahoma highways have a speed limit of 70 mph.

questions.question: When may you legally park in front of a driveway?
options: When the driveway is not in use
When the driveway is in your own property
When the space is marked for parking
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in front of a driveway.

questions.question: When should you use your headlights?
options: When visibility is less than 1000 feet
questions.explanation: Headlights should be used between sunset and sunrise, when visibility is poor, and in adverse weather conditions.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to skid?
options: Steer in the direction you want to go
Take your hands off the steering wheel
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to skid, steer in the direction you want the vehicle to go.

questions.question: What does a green arrow signal mean?
options: Proceed in the direction of the arrow
questions.correctAnswer: Proceed in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A green arrow signal means you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if the way is clear.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at a T-intersection with no signs or signals?
options: The vehicle on the through road
The vehicle on the terminating road
questions.correctAnswer: The vehicle on the through road
questions.explanation: At a T-intersection with no signs or signals, the vehicle on the through road has the right-of-way.
